text: Richard Wilhelm (10 May 18732 March 1930) was a German sinologist, theologian and missionary. ==Life== He lived in China for 25 years, he became fluent in spoken and written Chinese, and grew to love and admire the Chinese people. He is best known for his translations of philosophical works from Chinese into German, which have been translated into other major languages of the world, including English. His translation of the I Ching is still known as one of the finest. Also known for his translation of The Secret of the Golden Flower. Carl Jung, was a personal friend of Wilhelm.Richard Wilhelm at School of Wisdom Lau Nui Suan introduced Wilhelm to Chinese yoga philosophy and the psychology of the I Ching. ==Family and friends== His son Hellmut Wilhelm was also a sinologist, and was professor of Chinese at the University of Washington.
